title: When will Sinner play in Rome?
description: The Internazionali BNL d'ItaliaÂ has announced that Jannik Sinner will play his first match of the tournament on Saturday. The World No. 1 in the PIF ATP Rankings has a bye in the first round. He will take on countryman Federico Cina or Argentine Mariano Navone in the second round. It will be a first-time Lexus ATP Head2Head showdown regardless of opponent. You officially have a plan for the weekend ðŸ«µ#IBI25 pic.twitter.com/G0AFKKY3Sn â€” Internazionali BNL d'Italia (@InteBNLdItalia) May 5, 2025 The match will be Sinner's first since winning the Australian Open. The 23-year-old is returning after completing a three-month period of ineligibility in a case resolution agreement with WADA. According to the Infosys ATP Win/Loss Index, Sinner owns a 9-5 record in Rome. He is a four-time ATP Masters 1000 champion. The first seeded opponent Sinner could face is 25th seed Alejandro Davidovich Fokina. Sixth seed Casper Ruud, the Madrid champion, is a potential quarter-final opponent for the Italian. [NEWSLETTER FORM]

html:
Rome

Italian is the top seed on home soil

May 06, 2025

AFP/Getty Images

Jannik Sinner signs autographs for fans Monday evening at the Foro Italico. By ATP Staff

The Internazionali BNL d'ItaliaÂ has announced that Jannik Sinner will play his first match of the tournament on Saturday.

The World No. 1 in the PIF ATP Rankings has a bye in the first round. He will take on countryman Federico Cina or Argentine Mariano Navone in the second round. It will be a first-time Lexus ATP Head2Head showdown regardless of opponent.

You officially have a plan for the weekend ðŸ«µ#IBI25 pic.twitter.com/G0AFKKY3Sn

â€” Internazionali BNL d'Italia (@InteBNLdItalia) May 5, 2025

The match will be Sinner's first since winning the Australian Open. The 23-year-old is returning after completing a three-month period of ineligibility in a case resolution agreement with WADA.

According to the Infosys ATP Win/Loss Index, Sinner owns a 9-5 record in Rome. He is a four-time ATP Masters 1000 champion.

The first seeded opponent Sinner could face is 25th seed Alejandro Davidovich Fokina. Sixth seed Casper Ruud, the Madrid champion, is a potential quarter-final opponent for the Italian.
